{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.05011v1", "title": "Reality-infused Deep Learning Framework via Angle-resolved Metasurfaces", "summary": "Metasurfaces and optical Fourier surfaces (OFSs), featuring patterned
nanostructures and profiled diffractive elements, offer versatile platforms for
light field manipulation. Compared to tuning structural parameters, adjusting
incident light angles provides greater design flexibility. However,
angle-resolved light behaviors are often complex due to diverse mode
excitations and couplings, posing challenges for simulations and
nanofabrication. Here, we present a reality-infused deep learning framework
augmented by angle-resolved measuring technology, enabling precise and
real-time predictions of angular dispersion characteristics for metasurfaces
and OFSs. This approach captures critical fabrication and measurement
imperfections typically missed by conventional simulations. We demonstrate a
900-fold acceleration in the design process and accomplish near-perfect
prediction consistency to experimental results, with an impressive accuracy up
to 99.8%. Our study not only supports valuable insights into the development of
meta-devices but also represents a paradigm shift from simulation-driven to
reality-infused methods, paving the way for advancements in extensive optical
design applications.", "main_category": "physics.optics", "categories": "physics.optics,physics.app-ph", "published": "2025-05-08T07:31:25Z"}
